org.gearvrf

Class GVRActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRActivity

  • public class GVRActivity
extends java.lang.Object
    The typical GVRF application will have a single Android Activity, which must descend from GVRActivity, not directly from Activity. GVRActivity creates and manages the internal classes which use sensor data to manage a viewpoint, and thus present an appropriate stereoscopic view of your scene graph. GVRActivity also gives GVRF a full-screen window in landscape orientation with no title bar.

      • setScript

        public void setScript(GVRScript gvrScript,
                      java.lang.String distortionDataFileName)
        Links a script to the activity; sets the version; sets the lens distortion compensation parameters.
        Parameters:
        gvrScript - An instance of GVRScript to handle callbacks on the GL thread.
        distortionDataFileName - Name of the XML file containing the device parameters. We currently only support the Galaxy Note 4 because that is the only shipping device with the proper GL extensions. When more devices support GVRF, we will publish new device files, along with app-level auto-detect guidelines. This approach will let you support new devices, using the same version of GVRF that you have already tested and approved.

        The XML filename is relative to the application's assets directory, and can specify a file in a directory under the application's assets directory.
